content.description: Nice mixed climbing.    		Pitch 1: Climb the corner of the first pitch of Soul Survivor to the top of the initial buttress. Protect high and left and step right around the arete to the flake (small gear) and up the face on good holds past two bolts to a two bolt anchor with rings. 45
content.protection: Protect high and left (#2 or #3 Camalot)and step out around the corner to the flake (small gear) and up the face on good holds past two bolts to a two bolt anchor with rings. 45   Gear: Standard rack and draws. (Cams from #2- #3 are helpful at the start).
content.location:
Directions:  The climb starts up the beginning corner of Soul Survivor, 20 feet left of the start to Shifty Eyes; an obvious flake on the right face marks the start to the route. 

  Descent: Rap the route 

obvious landmark is the huge black corner which is the start to Soul Survivor, just right of Robinson Crusoe.

climbs.name: Shifty Eyes
climbs.fa: Peter Lewis, Brian Johnston, Dave Kelly

content.description:
The route follows a black streak in the center of the wall about 25-30 feet right of Soul Survivor 

  Scramble up past the first few bolts to where the route steepens and the climbing gets noticeably thinner. A tricky section around the fourth bolt leads to a small ledge. Up and slightly left past another bolt to an anchor 

  Fun climbing and cleaner than the neighboring routes.

climbs.name: Carpe Diem
climbs.fa: 4/20/14 Jonathan Baldassare, Jon Garlough & Lauren Bergeron

content.description: Climb on top of the ear shaped flake using finger sized nuts or cams.  Clip the first bolt and bust out the crux moves.  The climbing through the next couple bolts is only slightly easier.  After the third bolt, run it out up and right to the 2 ring bolt anchor.
content.protection: a couple finger sized pieces and three bolts.
content.location: On an attractive brown, steep slab buttress that is also home to the climbs "Straight Up"(5.9R) & "African Queen" (5.9+R).
